Kevin D. Roon                                                                        Kevin D. Roon                                                                    New York University Department of Linguistics 10 Washington Place, New York, NY 10003 email: kdroon@nyu.edu Affiliations: NYU PEP Lab  Advisor: Adamantios I. Gafos       My current Curriculum Vitae                                                                      Research Interests My primary research interests focus on the time course of planning in phonology, the nature of phonological representations, and formalizing the link between speech perception and production. Methodologically, I am interested in how computational modeling and experimental data can be used together to investigate theoretical linguistic questions. The models I have been developing make explicit predictions for response times, linguistic judgments, and phonetic modulation that can be tested experimentally in both speech production and perception. I also have a longstanding interest in the phonetics and phonology of Russian.       My dissertation, The dynamics of phonological planning , was successfully defended in October 2012. My dissertation research was awarded a Doctoral Dissertation Improvement Grant of $4,778 from the National Science Foundation, grant number 0951831 .
